The Indiana Forest Simulator (alias 'matrixmodel') is an R package with tools to simulate forest stocks in the state of Indiana (USA) into the future. It takes files in the "matrix model" format to simulate basal area (m2/ha) and density (trees per hectare, TPH), returning several summary outputs. These outputs then can be used to generate interactive plots.

To start, we are going to load the package into R:
```{r setup}
#remotes::install_github("panchorivasf/matrixmodel")
library(matrixmodel)
```
